result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricco Medina

records.addlTxt:
9:24 AM Defendant Ricco Medina in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status of counsel.
Defendant intends to proceed without representation after speaking with the State at the last hearing. 
Offer is contingent on AODA assessment and treatment. 
Defendant updates court on treatment he has received. Defendant to provide documentation to the District Attorney's office. 
Court sets a plea and sentencing date to comply with victim's rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:14 AM Defendant Ricco Medina in court.   Atty Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Judge Carter is covering hearing for Judge Dorow. 

Defendant requests a court appointed attorney. Court advises that he must first apply at the Public Defender's Office. Defendant has not yet applied at the PD's office.

State provided the Defendant with a pre-trial offer that would amend to ordinance upon treatment. 

Court will set matter over for Defendant to go to PD's office. Clerk provides Petition for Appointment of counsel paperwork as well.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

11:28 AM Defendant Ricco Medina appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant will proceed without counsel.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 1, 2022.
Request from defendant to appear by zoom.    **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 06/22/22 Complaint emailed to defendant.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 06/02/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
